H0.text: Genes are structures located on chromosomes that control characteristics of life and are passed from parents to offspring.

H1.text: Eggs are structures located on chromosomes that control characteristics of life and are passed from parents to offspring.

H2.text: Axons are structures located on chromosomes that control characteristics of life and are passed from parents to offspring.

H3.text: Cells are structures located on chromosomes that control characteristics of life and are passed from parents to offspring.

A4.text: The total complement of genes in an organism or cell is known as its genome, which may be stored on one or more chromosomes.

A5.text: Organisms inherit the characteristics of their parents because the cells of the offspring contain copies of the genes in their parents' cells.
